page.title: 06 BRAFIELD STADIUM
page.content: Brafield stadium lies between Hackleton and Brafield on an unclassified road off the A428 and B526. Since 1955, during the summer months it has become the venue for car races of many different types.These are usually held on Sunday though there are other meetings e.g.Bank holidays. Some of the cars which race at the stadium are:- Hot-rods which are very fast cars, Midgets which are very fast small cars, Bangers,which travel fairly fast but are allowed to knock into each other during the race.These are old vehicles which have been bought cheaply from a scrap-yard.Stock-cars also race while sometimes Ministars which are small cars for children between the ages of 10 and 16 are allowed to race.
